english: to drink; drink; to give a drink; imbibe

etymology.description: Oracle: 会意—酉 “bottle” + 人 “person” + 口 “mouth (with droplets)”. Later reanalyzed as 形声—phonetic 酓 + semantic 欠; in clerical script, 酓 was remodeled to 食.
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicted someone bending over a wine vessel to drink, with dots showing drops or saliva. Subsequent script stages reinterpreted it as a phono-semantic graph with 欠 expressing the opened mouth/act, while the left element served first as a phonetic (酓) and later as the food/drink semantic (食).
etymology.simplification: 食 on the left was simplified to the component 饣, yielding 饮; a standard 食→饣 left-side reduction.

examples.chinese: 医生嘱咐我多饮水(醫生囑咐我多飲水)。
examples.pinyin: Yīshēng zhǔfù wǒ duō yǐn shuǐ.
examples.english: The doctor told me to drink more water.

examples.chinese: 她给马饮水(她給馬飲水)。
examples.english: She gives the horse water to drink.
